text: [Music]
my name is Andy rosenbom I am the
director of web and desktop development
at Earth networks my role is to drive
the evolution of our web properties and
our desktop properties and deliver the
core value proposition that Earth
networks has in our weather and
observational data to users Earth
networks as a company manages operates
sensor networks across weather
observational data lightning data and
greenhouse gas data our Company motto is
taking the pulse of the planet which is
really a good description of what we do
and that we are pulling in all these
different observations that our sensors
are catching and distributing that to a
wide variety of
users we have millions of users on our
weather buug branded products which
include desktop mobile and web Amazon
web service was a great opportunity for
us to move move out of what was
historically a wholly owned data center
operation we were able to consolidate
out of what used to be four data centers
down to one and move those instances
into Amazon's ec2 we are no longer in
the business of managing data centers we
are in the business of data services and
providing weather information and
observational data to our users one of
the offerings that Amazon web services
had was cloudfront as a CDN the CDN use
case for Earth networks is really to
provide high- performing web-based
content to our users to provide the best
experience to our users we need to be
able to provide Dynamic content because
weather itself is dynamic we need to be
able to provide you know local
information to the user in near real
time we need to use a CDN that allows us
to adjust things like time to live
allows us to adjust things like query
strings and cookie information and pass
all that information back to the origin
to pull just what the user needs
with our previous content delivery
provider we chose them because they were
the market leader one of the challenges
that we had was that we essentially
spent the last 8 years optimizing under
the CDN we really needed to have code
written that was specific to them and
would only work under their platform so
we were literally bound to that platform
moving forward this caused our
development cost to be higher than what
would normally be and it wasn't
necessarily something we wanted to
continue to invest in we really took a
hard look at cloudfront and whether or
not that fit our needs as you know a p
provider of weather information to
millions of users when we concluded our
evaluation we looked at Cash hit ratio
we looked at performance you know we
looked at the cost savings and we looked
at the reduction in development time
which we would have and we chose Amazon
cloudfront as a weather provider and a
provider of information at a at a hyper
local level there's no way we could go
with a CDN and did not provide us both
Dynamic content and the ability to
optimize under things like query strings
and cookies and low ttls our use case
spans the entire array of features that
cloud F provides we were able to achieve
the same level of performance that we
had with our previous CDN without having
to write customized code to do
that any company looking for damic cash
ability in their CDN I would recommend
Amazon cloudfront you're going to see a
significant reduction in cost and great
performance uh for your end users we're
seeing about a little more than 50%
reduction in cost we're seeing an
equivalent Baseline in performance that
we saw with our previous CDN and
ultimately we're anticipating about a
20% reduction in Amazon ec2 uh origin
instances under Cloud front I'm actually
very excited about
the path that Amazon web service is
taking they are constantly adding new
features uh new offerings that we can
evaluate and take advantage of and you
feel like you're doing it with Amazon
web services
[Music]
